description:
Bifidobacterium hominis is a species of Gram-positive, anaerobic, and rod-shaped bacteria that are commonly found in the human gastrointestinal tract. It is a member of the Bifidobacteriaceae family, which are known to play a beneficial role in the human gut microbiome.

Bifidobacterium hominis is considered a probiotic, as it can contribute to the maintenance of a healthy gut environment. It is known to produce various metabolites, such as short-chain fatty acids, which can have positive effects on the host's health. This species is also believed to be involved in the metabolism of carbohydrates and the production of vitamins, particularly vitamins B and K.

The presence of Bifidobacterium hominis in the human gut has been associated with various health benefits, including the prevention and management of gastrointestinal disorders, the modulation of the immune system, and the potential to contribute to the overall well-being of the host.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species: Bifidobacterium hominis
